 33{
 34
 35template <typename OrderT,
 36	  typename ExtDataT>
 37inline void
 38chain_add(
 39  impl::Chain_builder& builder,
 40  ExtDataT&            ext,
 41  Domain<1> const&     dom)
 42{
 43  typedef typename ExtDataT::element_type element_type;
 44
 45  dimension_type const dim0 = OrderT::impl_dim0;
 46  assert(dim0 == 0);
 47
 48  builder.add<element_type>(sizeof(element_type) * dom.first()*ext.stride(dim0),
 49			  dom.stride() * ext.stride(dim0),
 50			  dom.length());
 51}
 52
 53
 54
 55template <typename OrderT,
 56	  typename ExtDataT>
 57inline void
 58chain_add(
 59  impl::Chain_builder& builder,
 60  ExtDataT&            ext,
 61  Domain<2> const&     dom)
 62{
 63  typedef typename ExtDataT::element_type element_type;
 64
 65  dimension_type const dim0 = OrderT::impl_dim0;
 66  dimension_type const dim1 = OrderT::impl_dim1;
 67
 68  builder.add<element_type>(
 69              sizeof(element_type) * (dom[dim0].first()*ext.stride(dim0) +
 70				      dom[dim1].first()*ext.stride(dim1)),
 71	      dom[dim0].stride() * ext.stride(dim0), dom[dim0].length(),
 72	      dom[dim1].stride() * ext.stride(dim1), dom[dim1].length());
 73}
 74
 75
 76
 77template <typename OrderT,
 78	  typename ExtDataT>
 79inline void
 80chain_add(
 81  impl::Chain_builder& builder,
 82  ExtDataT&            ext,
 83  Domain<3> const&    dom)
 84{
 85  typedef typename ExtDataT::element_type element_type;
 86
 87  dimension_type const dim0 = OrderT::impl_dim0;
 88  dimension_type const dim1 = OrderT::impl_dim1;
 89  dimension_type const dim2 = OrderT::impl_dim2;
 90
 91  for (index_type i = 0; i < dom[dim0].size(); ++i)
 92  {
 93    builder.add<element_type>(
 94                sizeof(element_type) *
 95		  ( (dom[dim0].first()+i*dom[dim0].stride())*ext.stride(dim0)
 96		  +  dom[dim1].first()                      *ext.stride(dim1)
 97		  +  dom[dim2].first()                      *ext.stride(dim2)),
 98		dom[dim1].stride() * ext.stride(dim1), dom[dim1].length(),
 99		dom[dim2].stride() * ext.stride(dim2), dom[dim2].length());
100  }
101}
102
103
104
105
106template <dimension_type Dim,
107	  typename       T,
108	  typename       Block,
109	  typename       AppMapT,
110	  typename       ExtDataT>
111void
112build_ext_array(
113  typename View_of_dim<Dim, T, Block>::const_type view,
114  AppMapT&                                      am,
115  ExtDataT**                                    array,
116  sync_action_type                              sync)
117{
118  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block>::type local_block_type;
119  typedef typename View_of_dim<Dim, T, local_block_type>::const_type
120		local_view_type;
121
122  processor_type rank = local_processor();
123
124  // First set all subblock ext pointers to NULL.
125  length_type tot_sb = am.num_subblocks();
126  for (index_type sb=0; sb<tot_sb; ++sb)
127    array[sb] = NULL;
128
129  // Then, initialize the subblocks this processor actually owns.
130  index_type sb = am.subblock(rank);
131  if (sb != no_subblock)
132  {
133    local_view_type local_view = get_local_view(view);
134    array[sb] = new ExtDataT(local_view.block(), sync);
135  }
136}
137
138
139
140template <typename ExtDataT>
141void
142cleanup_ext_array(
143  length_type num_subblocks,
144  ExtDataT**  array)
145{
146  for (index_type sb=0; sb<num_subblocks; ++sb)
147    if (array[sb] != NULL)
148      delete array[sb];
149}
150
151} // namespace par_chain_assign
152
153
154// Chained parallel assignment.
155template <dimension_type Dim,
156	  typename       T1,
157	  typename       T2,
158	  typename       Block1,
159	  typename       Block2>
160class Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>
161  : Compile_time_assert<Is_split_block<Block1>::value ==
162                        Is_split_block<Block2>::value>
163{
164  static dimension_type const dim = Dim;
165
166  // disable_copy should only be set to true for testing purposes.  It
167  // disables direct copy of data when source and destination are on
168  // the same processor, causing chains to be built on both sides.
169  // This is helps cover chain-to-chain copies for par-services-none.
170  static bool const disable_copy = false;
171
172  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block1>::type dst_local_block;
173  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block2>::type src_local_block;
174
175  typedef typename View_of_dim<dim, T1, dst_local_block>::type
176		dst_lview_type;
177
178  typedef typename View_of_dim<dim, T2, src_local_block>::const_type
179		src_lview_type;
180
181  typedef impl::Persistent_ext_data<src_local_block> src_ext_type;
182  typedef impl::Persistent_ext_data<dst_local_block> dst_ext_type;
183
184  typedef typename Block1::map_type dst_appmap_t;
185  typedef typename Block2::map_type src_appmap_t;
186
187  typedef typename Block_layout<Block1>::order_type dst_order_t;
188
189  typedef impl::Communicator::request_type request_type;
190  typedef impl::Communicator::chain_type   chain_type;
191
192  /// A Msg_record holds a piece of a data transfer that together
193  /// describe a complete communication.
194  ///
195  /// Members:
196  ///   PROC_ is the remote processor (to send to or receive from),
197  ///   SUBBLOCK_ is the local subblock to,
198  ///   DATA_ is the raw data pointer of the local subblock,
199  ///   CHAIN_ is the DMA chain representing the data from subblock_
200  ///      to send.
201  ///
202  /// Notes:
203  ///   [1] CHAIN_ completely describes the data to send/receive,
204  ///       but it is dependent on the distributed blocks storage
205  ///       location remaining unchanged from when the list is built
206  ///       to when it is executed.  SUBBLOCK_ and DATA_ are stored
207  ///       to check consistentcy and potentially update CHAIN_ if
208  ///       the storage location changes.
209
210  struct Msg_record
211  {
212    Msg_record(processor_type proc, index_type sb, chain_type chain)
213      : proc_    (proc),
214        subblock_(sb),
215	chain_   (chain)
216      {}
217
218  public:
219    processor_type proc_;    // destination processor
220    index_type     subblock_;
221    chain_type     chain_;
222  };
223
224
225
226  /// A Copy_record holds part of a data transfer where the source
227  /// and destination processors are the same.
228  ///
229  /// Members:
230  ///   SRC_SB_ is the source local subblock,
231  ///   DST_SB_ is the destination local subblock,
232  ///   SRC_DOM_ is the local domain within the source subblock to transfer,
233  ///   DST_DOM_ is the local domain within the destination subblock to
234  ///      transfer.
235
236  struct Copy_record
237  {
238    Copy_record(index_type src_sb, index_type dst_sb,
239	       Domain<Dim> src_dom,
240	       Domain<Dim> dst_dom)
241      : src_sb_  (src_sb),
242        dst_sb_  (dst_sb),
243	src_dom_ (src_dom),
244	dst_dom_ (dst_dom)
245      {}
246
247  public:
248    index_type     src_sb_;    // destination processor
249    index_type     dst_sb_;
250    Domain<Dim>    src_dom_;
251    Domain<Dim>    dst_dom_;
252  };
253
254
255  // Constructor.
256public:
257  Par_assign(
258    typename View_of_dim<Dim, T1, Block1>::type       dst,
259    typename View_of_dim<Dim, T2, Block2>::const_type src)
260    : dst_      (dst),
261      src_      (src.block()),
262      dst_am_   (dst_.block().map()),
263      src_am_   (src_.block().map()),
264      comm_     (dst_am_.impl_comm()),
265      send_list (),
266      recv_list (),
267      copy_list (),
268      req_list  (),
269      msg_count (0),
270      src_ext_ (new src_ext_type*[src_.block().map().num_subblocks()]),
271      dst_ext_ (new dst_ext_type*[dst_.block().map().num_subblocks()])
272  {
273    profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-cons");
274    assert(src_am_.impl_comm() == dst_am_.impl_comm());
275
276    par_chain_assign::build_ext_array<Dim, T2, Block2>(
277      src_, src_am_, src_ext_, impl::SYNC_IN);
278    par_chain_assign::build_ext_array<Dim, T1, Block1>(
279      dst_, dst_am_, dst_ext_, impl::SYNC_OUT);
280
281    build_send_list();
282    if (!disable_copy)
283      build_copy_list();
284    build_recv_list();
285  }
286
287  ~Par_assign()
288  {
289    // At destruction, the list of outstanding sends should be empty.
290    // This would be non-empty if:
291    //  - Par_assign did not to clear the lists after
292    //    processing it (library design error), or
293    //  - User executed send() without a corresponding wait().
294    assert(req_list.size() == 0);
295
296    if (send_list.size() > 0)
297    {
298      typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator sl_iterator;
299      sl_iterator sl_cur = send_list.begin();
300      sl_iterator sl_end = send_list.end();
301      for (; sl_cur != sl_end; ++sl_cur)
302      {
303	impl::free_chain((*sl_cur).chain_);
304      }
305    }
306
307    if (recv_list.size() > 0)
308    {
309      typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator rl_iterator;
310      rl_iterator rl_cur = recv_list.begin();
311      rl_iterator rl_end = recv_list.end();
312      for (; rl_cur != rl_end; ++rl_cur)
313      {
314	impl::free_chain((*rl_cur).chain_);
315      }
316    }
317
318    par_chain_assign::cleanup_ext_array(dst_am_.num_subblocks(), dst_ext_);
319    par_chain_assign::cleanup_ext_array(src_am_.num_subblocks(), src_ext_);
320
321    delete[] dst_ext_;
322    delete[] src_ext_;
323  }
324
325
326  // Implementation functions.
327private:
328
329  void build_send_list();
330  void build_recv_list();
331  void build_copy_list();
332
333  void exec_send_list();
334  void exec_recv_list();
335  void exec_copy_list();
336
337  void wait_send_list();
338
339  void cleanup() {}	// Cleanup send_list buffers.
340
341
342  // Invoke the parallel assignment
343public:
344  void operator()()
345  {
346    if (send_list.size() > 0) exec_send_list();
347    if (copy_list.size() > 0) exec_copy_list();
348    if (recv_list.size() > 0) exec_recv_list();
349
350    if (req_list.size() > 0)  wait_send_list();
351
352    cleanup();
353  }
354
355
356  // Private member data.
357private:
358  typename View_of_dim<Dim, T1, Block1>::type       dst_;
359  typename View_of_dim<Dim, T2, Block2>::const_type src_;
360
361  dst_appmap_t const& dst_am_;
362  src_appmap_t const& src_am_;
363  impl::Communicator& comm_;
364
365  std::vector<Msg_record>    send_list;
366  std::vector<Msg_record>    recv_list;
367  std::vector<Copy_record>   copy_list;
368
369  std::vector<request_type> req_list;
370
371  int                       msg_count;
372
373  src_ext_type**            src_ext_;
374  dst_ext_type**            dst_ext_;
375};
376
377
378
379/***********************************************************************
380  Definitions
381***********************************************************************/
382
383// Build the send_list, a list of processor-subblock-local_domain
384// records.  This can be done in advance of the actual assignment.
385
386template <dimension_type Dim,
387	  typename       T1,
388	  typename       T2,
389	  typename       Block1,
390	  typename       Block2>
391void
392Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::build_send_list()
393{
394  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-build_send_list");
395  processor_type rank = local_processor();
396
397#if VSIPL_IMPL_PCA_ROTATE
398  index_type  offset = src_am_.impl_rank_from_proc(rank);
399#endif
400  length_type dsize  = dst_am_.impl_working_size();
401  // std::min(dst_am_.num_subblocks(), dst_am_.impl_pvec().size());
402
403#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
404    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
405	      << "build_send_list(dsize: " << dsize
406	      << ") -------------------------------------\n";
407#endif
408
409  index_type src_sb = src_am_.subblock(rank);
410
411  // If multiple processors have the subblock, the first processor
412  // is responsible for sending it.
413
414  if (src_sb != no_subblock &&
415      *(src_am_.processor_begin(src_sb)) == rank)
416  {
417    // Iterate over all processors
418    for (index_type pi=0; pi<dsize; ++pi)
419    {
420      // Rotate message order so processors don't all send to 0, then 1, etc
421      // (Currently does not work, it needs to take into account the
422      // number of subblocks).
423#if VSIPL_IMPL_PCA_ROTATE
424      processor_type proc = dst_am_.impl_proc_from_rank((pi + offset) % dsize);
425#else
426      processor_type proc = dst_am_.impl_proc_from_rank(pi);
427#endif
428
429      // Transfers that stay on this processor is handled by the copy_list.
430      if (!disable_copy && proc == rank)
431	continue;
432
433      index_type dst_sb = dst_am_.subblock(proc);
434
435      if (dst_sb != no_subblock)
436      {
437	// Check to see if destination processor already has block
438	if (!disable_copy && processor_has_block(src_am_, proc, src_sb))
439	  continue;
440
441	impl::Chain_builder builder;
442	src_ext_type* ext = src_ext_[src_sb];
443	ext->begin();
444
445	for (index_type dp=0; dp<num_patches(dst_, dst_sb); ++dp)
446	{
447	  Domain<dim> dst_dom = global_domain(dst_, dst_sb, dp);
448
449	  for (index_type sp=0; sp<num_patches(src_, src_sb); ++sp)
450	  {
451	    Domain<dim> src_dom  = global_domain(src_, src_sb, sp);
452	    Domain<dim> src_ldom = local_domain(src_, src_sb, sp);
453
454	    Domain<dim> intr;
455
456	    if (intersect(src_dom, dst_dom, intr))
457	    {
458	      Domain<dim> send_dom = apply_intr(src_ldom, src_dom, intr);
459
460	      par_chain_assign::chain_add<dst_order_t>(builder, *ext, send_dom);
461
462#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 2
463	      std::cout << "(" << rank << ") send "
464			<< rank << "/" << src_sb << "/" << sp
465			<< " -> "
466			<< proc << "/" << dst_sb << "/" << dp
467			<< " src: " << src_dom
468			<< " dst: " << dst_dom
469			<< " intr: " << intr
470			<< " send: " << send_dom
471		// << " val: " << get(local_view, first(send_dom))
472			<< std::endl;
473#endif
474	    }
475	  }
476	}
477	if (!builder.is_empty())
478	  send_list.push_back(Msg_record(proc, src_sb, builder.get_chain()));
479	ext->end();
480      }
481    }
482  }
483}
484
485
486
487// Build the recv_list, a list of processor-subblock-local_domain
488// records.  This can be done in advance of the actual assignment.
489
490template <dimension_type Dim,
491	  typename       T1,
492	  typename       T2,
493	  typename       Block1,
494	  typename       Block2>
495void
496Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::build_recv_list()
497{
498  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-build_recv_list");
499  processor_type rank = local_processor();
500
501#if VSIPL_IMPL_PCA_ROTATE
502  index_type  offset = dst_am_.impl_rank_from_proc(rank);
503#endif
504  length_type ssize  = src_am_.impl_working_size();
505
506#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
507    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
508	      << "build_recv_list(ssize: " << ssize
509	      << ") -------------------------------------\n";
510#endif
511
512  index_type dst_sb = dst_am_.subblock(rank);
513
514  if (dst_sb != no_subblock)
515  {
516    dst_ext_type* ext = dst_ext_[dst_sb];
517    ext->begin();
518      
519    // Iterate over all sending processors
520    for (index_type pi=0; pi<ssize; ++pi)
521    {
522      // Rotate message order so processors don't all send to 0,
523      // then 1, etc (Currently does not work, it needs to take into
524      // account the number of subblocks).
525      // processor_type proc = (src_am_.impl_proc_from_rank(pi) + rank) % size;
526      processor_type proc = src_am_.impl_proc_from_rank(pi);
527
528      // Transfers that stay on this processor is handled by the copy_list.
529      if (!disable_copy && proc == rank)
530	continue;
531      
532      impl::Chain_builder builder;
533      
534      index_type src_sb = src_am_.subblock(proc);
535
536      // If multiple processors have the subblock, the first processor
537      // is responsible for sending it to us.
538
539      if (src_sb != no_subblock &&
540	  *(src_am_.processor_begin(src_sb)) == proc)
541      {
542	// Check to see if destination processor already has block
543	if (!disable_copy && processor_has_block(src_am_, rank, src_sb))
544	  continue;
545
546	for (index_type dp=0; dp<num_patches(dst_, dst_sb); ++dp)
547	{
548	  Domain<dim> dst_dom  = global_domain(dst_, dst_sb, dp);
549	  Domain<dim> dst_ldom = local_domain(dst_, dst_sb, dp);
550	  
551	  for (index_type sp=0; sp<num_patches(src_, src_sb); ++sp)
552	  {
553	    Domain<dim> src_dom = global_domain(src_, src_sb, sp);
554	    
555	    Domain<dim> intr;
556	    
557	    if (intersect(dst_dom, src_dom, intr))
558	    {
559	      Domain<dim> recv_dom = apply_intr(dst_ldom, dst_dom, intr);
560	      
561	      par_chain_assign::chain_add<dst_order_t>(builder, *ext, recv_dom);
562	      
563#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
564	      std::cout << "(" << rank << ") recv "
565			<< rank << "/" << dst_sb << "/" << dp
566			<< " <- "
567			<< proc << "/" << src_sb << "/" << sp
568			<< " dst: " << dst_dom
569			<< " src: " << src_dom
570			<< " intr: " << intr
571			<< " recv: " << recv_dom
572		// << " val: " << get(local_view, first(recv_dom))
573			<< std::endl;
574#endif
575	    }
576	  }
577	}
578      }
579      if (!builder.is_empty())
580	recv_list.push_back(Msg_record(proc, dst_sb, builder.get_chain()));
581    }
582    ext->end();
583  }
584}
585
586
587
588template <dimension_type Dim,
589	  typename       T1,
590	  typename       T2,
591	  typename       Block1,
592	  typename       Block2>
593void
594Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::build_copy_list()
595{
596  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-build_copy_list");
597  processor_type rank = local_processor();
598
599#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
600  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
601	    << "build_copy_list(num_procs: " << src_am_.num_processors()
602	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
603#endif
604
605  index_type dst_sb = dst_am_.subblock(rank);
606  if (dst_sb != no_subblock)
607  {
608
609    index_type src_sb = src_am_.subblock(rank);
610    if (src_sb != no_subblock)
611    {
612      for (index_type dp=0; dp<num_patches(dst_, dst_sb); ++dp)
613      {
614	Domain<dim> dst_dom  = global_domain(dst_, dst_sb, dp);
615	Domain<dim> dst_ldom = local_domain (dst_, dst_sb, dp);
616
617	for (index_type sp=0; sp<num_patches(src_, src_sb); ++sp)
618	{
619	  Domain<dim> src_dom  = global_domain(src_, src_sb, sp);
620	  Domain<dim> src_ldom = local_domain (src_, src_sb, sp);
621
622	  Domain<dim> intr;
623
624#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 2
625//	  std::cout << " - dst " << dst_sb << "/" << dp << std::endl
626//		    << "   src " << src_sb     << "/" << sp << std::endl
627//	    ;
628#endif
629
630	  if (intersect(src_dom, dst_dom, intr))
631	  {
632	    Domain<dim> send_dom = apply_intr(src_ldom, src_dom, intr);
633	    Domain<dim> recv_dom = apply_intr(dst_ldom, dst_dom, intr);
634
635	    copy_list.push_back(Copy_record(src_sb, dst_sb,
636					    send_dom, recv_dom));
637
638#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 2
639	    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
640		      << "copy src: " << src_sb << "/" << sp
641		      << " " << send_dom
642		      << "  dst: " << dst_sb << "/" << dp
643		      << " " << recv_dom
644		      << std::endl
645		      << "    "
646		      << "src_dom: " << src_dom
647		      << "  src_ldom: " << src_ldom
648		      << std::endl
649		      << "    "
650		      << "dst_dom: " << dst_dom
651		      << "  dst_ldom: " << dst_ldom
652		      << std::endl
653		      << "  intr: " << intr
654		      << std::endl
655	      ;
656#endif
657	  }
658	}
659      }
660    }
661  }
662}
663
664
665
666// Execute the send_list.
667
668template <dimension_type Dim,
669	  typename       T1,
670	  typename       T2,
671	  typename       Block1,
672	  typename       Block2>
673void
674Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::exec_send_list()
675{
676  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-exec_send_list");
677
678#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
679  processor_type rank = local_processor();
680  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
681	    << "exec_send_list(size: " << send_list.size()
682	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
683#endif
684  typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator sl_iterator;
685
686  {
687    sl_iterator sl_cur = send_list.begin();
688    sl_iterator sl_end = send_list.end();
689    for (; sl_cur != sl_end; ++sl_cur)
690    {
691      impl::Chain_builder builder;
692      processor_type proc = (*sl_cur).proc_;
693
694      src_ext_type* ext = src_ext_[(*sl_cur).subblock_];
695      ext->begin();
696      builder.stitch(ext->data(), (*sl_cur).chain_);
697      ext->end();
698      
699      chain_type chain = builder.get_chain();
700      request_type   req;
701      comm_.send(proc, chain, req);
702      impl::free_chain(chain);
703      req_list.push_back(req);
704    }
705  }
706}
707
708
709
710// Execute the recv_list.
711
712template <dimension_type Dim,
713	  typename       T1,
714	  typename       T2,
715	  typename       Block1,
716	  typename       Block2>
717void
718Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::exec_recv_list()
719{
720  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-exec_recv_list");
721
722#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
723  processor_type rank = local_processor();
724  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
725	    << "exec_recv_list(size: " << recv_list.size()
726	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
727#endif
728
729  typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator rl_iterator;
730  rl_iterator rl_cur = recv_list.begin();
731  rl_iterator rl_end = recv_list.end();
732    
733  for (; rl_cur != rl_end; ++rl_cur)
734  {
735    impl::Chain_builder builder;
736    processor_type proc = (*rl_cur).proc_;
737
738    dst_ext_type* ext = dst_ext_[(*rl_cur).subblock_];
739    ext->begin();
740    builder.stitch(ext->data(), (*rl_cur).chain_);
741    ext->end();
742
743    chain_type chain = builder.get_chain();
744    comm_.recv(proc, chain);
745    impl::free_chain(chain);
746  }
747}
748
749
750
751// Execute the copy_list.
752
753template <dimension_type Dim,
754	  typename       T1,
755	  typename       T2,
756	  typename       Block1,
757	  typename       Block2>
758void
759Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::exec_copy_list()
760{
761  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Chained_assign>-exec_copy_list");
762
763#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 1
764  processor_type rank = local_processor();
765  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
766	    << "exec_copy_list(size: " << copy_list.size()
767	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
768#endif
769
770  src_lview_type src_lview = get_local_view(src_);
771  dst_lview_type dst_lview = get_local_view(dst_);
772
773  typedef typename std::vector<Copy_record>::iterator cl_iterator;
774  for (cl_iterator cl_cur = copy_list.begin();
775       cl_cur != copy_list.end();
776       ++cl_cur)
777  {
778    view_assert_local(src_, (*cl_cur).src_sb_);
779    view_assert_local(dst_, (*cl_cur).dst_sb_);
780
781    dst_lview((*cl_cur).dst_dom_) = src_lview((*cl_cur).src_dom_);
782#if PCA_VERBOSE >= 2
783    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
784	      << "src subblock: " << (*cl_cur).src_sb_ << " -> "
785	      << "dst subblock: " << (*cl_cur).dst_sb_ << std::endl
786	      << dst_lview((*cl_cur).dst_dom_);
787
788    // std::cout << "  from: " << (*cl_cur).src_dom_ << std::endl;
789    // std::cout << "  to  : " << (*cl_cur).dst_dom_ << std::endl;
790#endif
791  }
792}
793
794
795
796// Wait for the send_list instructions to be completed.
797
798template <dimension_type Dim,
799	  typename       T1,
800	  typename       T2,
801	  typename       Block1,
802	  typename       Block2>
803void
804Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Chained_assign>::wait_send_list()
805{
806  typename std::vector<request_type>::iterator
807		cur = req_list.begin(),
808		end = req_list.end();
809  for(; cur != end; ++cur)
810  {
811    comm_.wait(*cur);
812  }
813  req_list.clear();
814}
815
